title: Dave Robinson's Music Adventure in Ukraine
summary: Dave Robinson is an 82-year-old man who loves music. He used to work with famous bands like Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles. Now, he helps bring live music to Ukraine, even though there is a war. He traveled close to the front line with a band called Hardwicke Circus. Dave got sick with pneumonia but still wants to keep going. He thinks touring is very important for musicians to get better. He started as a photographer in the 1960s and took pictures of The Beatles. Dave believes that playing live shows helps bands improve, just like The Beatles did when they toured in Hamburg.

background_read: Dave Robinson is an older man who has worked in music for many years. He helped start a record company called Stiff Records and worked with famous musicians. Now, he is traveling to Ukraine, a country with a war, to support live music. This shows how music can bring joy even in hard times. Kids can learn about perseverance and the power of art from his story.
Article_Structure: WHO: Dave Robinson, an 82-year-old music manager and photographer
WHAT: He helps bring live music to war-torn Ukraine and believes touring is key for musicians
WHERE: Ukraine, near the front line, and places like Liverpool
WHY: To support musicians and show that music can continue during difficult times

perspectives.description: Dave shows that music can thrive even in war zones, bringing hope and connection.
